result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacy L Conroy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Stacy L Conroy is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Stacy L Conroy was found guilty of Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: *To any other sentence. With credit for 2 days time served.
*Same conditions as probation except for condition time.

*AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
*Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

miscConds.notes: *Restitution in the amount of $4,182.97 to Matthew G. subject to verification.  Parties state this amount may have already been paid by insurance.

*Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, these charges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
*Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, these charges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
*Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job; if defendant is in school part-time, defendant to have a full-time job
*Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor.

*No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
*No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses  or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
*No alcohol or controlled substances.
*Defendant can not drive without a valid drivers license.

*Cooperate with agent.
*Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
*Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
*Defendant may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: *Huber release privileges for work, child care and on-going treatment.  No electronic monitoring.  No good time credit.
*Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service, at a not for profit organization, supervised.  Defendant to provide proof of completed service.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Injury by Use of Vehicle with PAC

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stacy L Conroy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter in response to defendant's request for good time.
Defendant's pro se request for good time.
Decision and Order Denying Request for Good Time signed and filed.  Copy sent to State and Defendant.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William Brash, Br. 21, for review. jbs
Letter from defendant seeking good time.
Letter from Joan Rossetti Business Service Specialist DPW-Administration in regards to Integrity Mutual Insurance paid the damages in full.
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Stacy L Conroy in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED to be used as a read-in on COUNT 1.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for  5 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, with credit for 2 days time served, consecutive to any other sentence.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 4 YEARS with the following conditions:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution in the amount of $4,182.97 to Matthew G. subject to verification.  Parties state this amount may have already been paid by insurance
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, these charges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, these charges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses  or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job; if defendant is in school part-time, defendant to have a full-time job 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 1 YEAR in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for work, child care and on-going treatment.  No electronic monitoring.  No good time credit.
-Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service, at a not for profit organization, supervised.  Defendant to provide proof of completed service
-Defendant's drivers license revoked for 2 years
-Ignition interlock for 2 years
-Defendant can not drive without a valid drivers license  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate 
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit form 
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Stacy L Conroy in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for plea and sentencing.  Parties requested an adjournment as negotiations are still on going. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed with court.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense needs additional time to review discovery materials and offer; request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Stacy L Conroy in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No driving without a valid license.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Stacy L Conroy in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Defendant Stacy L Conroy in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Stacy L Conroy not in court.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
